Package org.apache.spark.memory

Class MemoryConsumer

java.lang.Object
org.apache.spark.memory.MemoryConsumer
Direct Known Subclasses:
BytesToBytesMap, UnsafeExternalSorter
public abstract class MemoryConsumer extends Object
A memory consumer of TaskMemoryManager that supports spilling. Note: this only supports allocation / spilling of Tungsten memory.

      IOException

    • spill

      public abstract long spill(long size, MemoryConsumer trigger) throws IOException
      Spill some data to disk to release memory, which will be called by TaskMemoryManager when there is not enough memory for the task. This should be implemented by subclass. Note: In order to avoid possible deadlock, should not call acquireMemory() from spill(). Note: today, this only frees Tungsten-managed pages.
      Parameters:
      size - the amount of memory should be released
      trigger - the MemoryConsumer that trigger this spilling
      Returns:
      the amount of released memory in bytes
      Throws:
      IOException

    • allocateArray

      public org.apache.spark.unsafe.array.LongArray allocateArray(long size)
      Allocates a LongArray of `size`. Note that this method may throw `SparkOutOfMemoryError` if Spark doesn't have enough memory for this allocation, or throw `TooLargePageException` if this `LongArray` is too large to fit in a single page. The caller side should take care of these two exceptions, or make sure the `size` is small enough that won't trigger exceptions.
      Throws:
      SparkOutOfMemoryError
      TooLargePageException

    • freeArray

      public void freeArray(org.apache.spark.unsafe.array.LongArray array)
